summary: A small Riverwood home. Like we need more of those? Ah, but it's pretty! Adoption friendly, too!
descriptionHtml:
[center][font=Verdana][color=#8e7cc3][u][size=6]~Black Stallion Lodge~[/size][/u][/color][/font][/center][center]

This week I felt like downsizing from my larger mods. A good, starter player home in [color=#00ff00]Riverwood[/color]. I know, there's good and plenty of those around. Like, dozens, probably. But this is more of a Me project, and it turned out really nice, I say!

[img]http://i.imgur.com/2WzhvBg.gif[/img]

Remember White Stallion Lodge from Oblivion? That was a nice little free home. Here, I had designed this place in mind to give a new character some interest in the DLC's and their aesthetics, and maybe giving a small reminder of that nice Oblivion home. There are some Redoran decorations, Snow Elf ruins, Telvanni mushrooms, all to fit pleasantly in a Nord style cabin. It sits well in the landscape and looks like it was a natural part of the Riverwood area. A perfect place to start on your way to Whiterun, or a good place to fit with the roleplaying characteristic of someone not so stinking rich.

All in all:
- [color=#00ffff]ADOPTION FRIENDLY![/color] With 2 beds aside from the master bedroom.
- Unique displays and crafting stations, including a staff enchanter.
(This is without Smithing stations, as Alvor's is right next door)
- Three mannequins and several weapon displays, and 2 bookshelf rows with a Winterhold bookcase.
- Plenty of idle markers to make the house livable for npc's.
- Unconventional oddities like a new fireplace, unique static objects, ClefJ's Redoran door, etc.
- Day/Night light cycle.
- Lower to middle-class decorations and furniture, good for a starting adventurer.
- All yours from the get-go.

Requirements:
- Update
- Dawnguard
- Dragonborn
- Hearthfire

[color=#ff0000]Incompatabilities:[/color]
- Anything modifying the RiverwoodBridge cell next to the roadsigns. There's probably a few there.

[color=#00ffff]Thanks and Credits:[/color]
- Elianora for her unique container and static objects!
- Darkrider for his wall painting resources! [/center]
author: ClefJ
